column4: Hello, I have a few questions about ubuntu - does it use the latest kernel or does it backport security patches to an old stable one? Also, do the repositories have cutting-edge releases or just old stable ones? (e.g. a new version of eclipse comes out, does it get released on the repositories after a few days or after a few weeks when deemed stable/secure)?
Heh, you get a brand new release every 6 months, how much more cutting edge do you want ;)
For flash, why again not just sudo apt-get install flash-plugin-nonfree
I don't really care about the ubuntu versioning system.. I care about the version of the application running on the system
